effective_dosage: MIC against mixed biofilms was 10 mM; treatment at 2× MIC (20 mM) was used.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Rutin as a safer alternative to Methylprednisolone for treating spinal cord injury by improving its bioavailability through nanomedicine encapsulation.
results_summary: The study found that Rutin, when encapsulated in a drug-free polypeptide (PAH), showed potential for mitigating secondary spinal cord injury by scavenging toxic aldehydes, offering a novel approach to replace Methylprednisolone.
population_specificity: SCI rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether rutin could protect blood-brain barrier (BBB) integrity and cognitive function in a chronic stress model and explore its underlying molecular mechanisms.
results_summary: Rutin attenuated BBB hyperpermeability and cognitive impairment in stressed mice, promoted brain microvascular endothelial cell function, and stabilized Claudin-5 expression by modulating the HDAC1‒Claudin-5 axis, ultimately reducing neuroinflammation.
population_specificity: Chronic unpredictable mild stress (CUMS) mouse model and hCMEC/D3 human brain microvascular endothelial cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective role of rutin against paclitaxel-induced toxicities in mice, focusing on oxidative stress and apoptosis.
results_summary: Rutin co-administration significantly reduced ROS and NO levels, activated the NRF2-mediated antioxidant pathway, and inhibited apoptosis in bone marrow, liver, and kidney tissues, demonstrating chemoprotective effects against paclitaxel toxicity.
population_specificity: BALB/c mice
effective_dosage: 20 mg/kg body weight, administered daily via oral gavage
study_duration: Not explicitly stated (alternate-day paclitaxel administration suggests a multi-day study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the wound healing potential of rutin-loaded P407 hydrogels compared to free rutin and commercial wound dressings.
results_summary: The study found that rutin-loaded P407 hydrogels significantly enhanced cell proliferation in human keratinocytes and improved wound healing in rats more effectively than free rutin or DuoDERM, with increased epithelialization and collagen synthesis.
population_specificity: Human keratinocytes (in vitro) and rats (in vivo).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether rutin mitigates ZEA-induced apoptosis in porcine endometrial stromal cells and the role of Nrf2 in this process.
results_summary: Rutin alleviated ZEA-induced apoptosis by activating Nrf2, which counteracted oxidative stress, endoplasmic reticulum stress, and mitochondrial dysfunction caused by ZEA.
population_specificity: Porcine endometrial stromal cells (ESCs)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess Rutin's therapeutic efficacy in treating inflammatory pain induced by complete Freund's adjuvant (CFA) in rats, focusing on its anti-inflammatory, antinociceptive, and antioxidant properties.
results_summary: Rutin significantly reduced paw swelling, pain responses, arthritis scores, and body weight loss, comparable to indomethacin. It also lowered TNF-α levels, increased antioxidant enzyme activities (catalase, SOD), and reduced oxidative stress markers (MDA).
population_specificity: Wistar rats with CFA-induced arthritis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether rutin and quercetin could improve fertility and pregnancy rates in livestock and mice through in vitro fertilization (IVF) and oral administration.
results_summary: Rutin and quercetin increased IVF fertilization rates by more than twofold when added to the preculture medium and improved pregnancy outcomes in aged male and nulliparous female mice when administered orally.
population_specificity: Livestock (cattle) and mice (aged males and nulliparous females).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy and mechanism of action of Rutin in alleviating symptoms of PMDD-depressed subtype in rats, focusing on its interaction with GABAA receptors.
results_summary: Rutin bound to GABAA receptor benzodiazepine sites, inhibited chloride ion flow, and alleviated depressed mood, memory impairment, and social impairment in PMDD-depressed subtype rats. It also reduced GABA and ACh levels without affecting GABAA receptor subunit mRNA expression.
population_specificity: PMDD-depressed subtype model rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether rutin could reduce body weight, fasting blood glucose, and inflammation in T2DM mice by modulating gut microbiota.
results_summary: Rutin was more effective than proanthocyanidins in reducing inflammation and fat hypertrophy, significantly lowered body weight and fasting blood glucose within 2 weeks, and altered gut microbiota composition, particularly increasing beneficial probiotics.
population_specificity: T2DM mice induced with a high-fat diet.
effective_dosage: 200 mg/kg per day, administered via oral gavage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate liposomal rutin for targeted rheumatoid arthritis therapy, focusing on its antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties.
results_summary: The optimized rutin liposome (LP2) showed enhanced stability, antioxidant activity, and anti-inflammatory effects, reducing inflammation and protein denaturation in vitro.
population_specificity: In vitro study (no human or animal subjects specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the potential mechanism of rutin in treating triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) using network pharmacology and in vitro experiments.
results_summary: Rutin inhibited the growth of the MDA-MB-231 cell line, induced cell death, and decreased the expressions of IL6, TNF, INS, and EGFR, confirming its multi-target effects for TNBC treatment.
population_specificity: Triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) cell line (MDA-MB-231).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the mechanism by which rutin provides protection against drug-induced nephropathy using network pharmacology and molecular docking.
results_summary: The study identified multiple target pathways involved in drug-induced nephropathy and found that rutin can inhibit various metabolic and proinflammatory pathways, suggesting its potential for prevention and treatment.
population_specificity: Not specified (in silico study using databases and computational methods).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the synergistic antibacterial effects of rutin, particularly in combination with amikacin, and explore the underlying mechanisms of this synergy.
results_summary: The study found that rutin and amikacin exhibited significant synergistic antibacterial effects, disrupting the cell membrane of E. coli and causing leakage of intracellular components. The combination inhibited bacterial growth within 8 hours and demonstrated low MIC and MBC values.
population_specificity: Escherichia coli (E. coli) in vitro
effective_dosage: MIC range 0.125-1 mg/mL, MBC range 0.125-2 mg/mL

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Rutin's potential as a SARS-CoV-2 RdRp inhibitor by comparing its binding efficacy and stability to Remdesivir.
results_summary: Rutin demonstrated superior binding stability and inhibitory effects against SARS-CoV-2 RdRp, with significantly lower IC50 values (60.09 nM for RdRp and 0.598 µg/ml for SARS-CoV-2) compared to Remdesivir. The selectivity index (SI: 1078) indicated a high margin of safety for Rutin.
population_specificity: In vitro and computational studies (no human or animal subjects specified).
study_duration: Not specified (200 ns MD simulation mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how roasting affects the antibacterial and antioxidant properties of Sophora japonica buds, particularly focusing on changes in rutin and quercetin content.
results_summary: Dark yellow-roasted Sophora japonica buds showed the strongest antibacterial and antioxidant activities, with higher quercetin content due to heat-induced conversion from rutin. Quercetin demonstrated significantly stronger antibacterial and antioxidant effects than rutin.
population_specificity: Sophora japonica buds (plant material)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and safety of rutin, combined with temozolomide in a hybrid nanofiber mesh, for localized treatment of glioblastoma.
results_summary: The combination of rutin and temozolomide in the nanofiber mesh significantly reduced tumor volume, inhibited tumor cell growth, and activated apoptotic pathways without causing local inflammation or systemic adverse effects.
population_specificity: Orthotopic C6-induced glioblastoma rat model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anticancer properties of rutin-conjugated zinc oxide nanoparticles (Rut-ZnO NPs) against chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) cells.
results_summary: ZnO-Rut NPs showed good cytocompatibility with peripheral blood mononuclear cells (viability >85% at ≤100 μg/mL) and significantly reduced K562 cell viability (92% to 31% at 3.125–400 μg/mL). The NPs induced apoptosis (late apoptosis increased from 11% to 50.9%) and modulated Bax/Bcl-2 gene expression, suggesting a pro-apoptotic mechanism.
population_specificity: Chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) cells (K562 cell line) and peripheral blood mononuclear cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the protective effects of rutin on podocytes in diabetic nephropathy using network pharmacology and experimental validation in db/db mice and human podocyte cell models.
results_summary: Rutin showed significant renoprotective effects, reducing blood glucose, proteinuria, and improving renal function in db/db mice. It inhibited Src kinase, reduced EGFR/ERK phosphorylation, and exhibited antioxidant properties by lowering ROS levels and increasing SOD activity.
population_specificity: db/db mice (a model for type 2 diabetes and diabetic nephropathy) and human podocyte cell models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a pH-responsive nanogel for targeted rutin delivery and evaluate its therapeutic efficacy against cancer cell lines.
results_summary: The nanogel demonstrated high rutin encapsulation (86.14%) and pH-selective release, significantly reducing IC50 values in four cancer cell lines (HepG2, A549, MCF-7, HCT-116) and showing strong binding interactions with VEGFR-2 and EGFRT790M.
population_specificity: Human cancer cell lines (HepG2, A549, MCF-7, HCT-116).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effect of Rutin on acrylamide-induced sciatic nerve injury in rats and explore its mechanism.
results_summary: Rutin increased SOD activity and GSH content, decreased LDH activity, and promoted the expression of MBP, ERK1/2, P-ERK1/2, and Nrf2, suggesting it protects against acrylamide-induced nerve injury via ERK1/2 pathway activation and oxidative stress alleviation.
population_specificity: Rats with acrylamide-induced sciatic nerve injury
effective_dosage: Middle and high dose groups (specific amounts not provided)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether rutin could mitigate the adverse reproductive effects of a high-sucrose diet in Drosophila melanogaster.
results_summary: Rutin, particularly at 200 µM, reduced oxidative stress, restored reproductive fitness, and normalized enzyme activities disrupted by a high-sucrose diet. It also mitigated gonadal ROS production, tissue injuries, and protein/lipid oxidation.
population_specificity: Drosophila melanogaster (fruit flies)
study_duration: From first instar larvae to adult stage

study_goal: The researchers aimed to enhance the bioavailability and brain-targeting ability of Rutin by developing transferrin-modified Rutin liposomes (Tf-Rutin-Lip) to improve its efficacy in treating brain disorders.
results_summary: The study found that Tf-Rutin-Lip significantly improved brain targeting and pharmacokinetic parameters (e.g., Cmax, AUC) compared to free Rutin, without affecting BBB tight junctions or bEnd.3 cell viability. The liposomal formulation demonstrated enhanced efficacy for potential brain disorder treatments.
population_specificity: In vitro (bEnd.3 cells) and in vivo models (specifics not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether rutin, a component of Rosa canina L. extract, could restore cholesterol levels and improve protein trafficking in fibroblasts from NPC patients.
results_summary: Rutin reduced cellular cholesterol levels but did not affect the trafficking pathway of NPC1 mutants, unlike the full Rosa canina L. extract. Its effects were distinct from miglustat, an approved NPC treatment.
population_specificity: Fibroblasts derived from NPC patients with specific NPC1 mutations (I1061T/P887L, R1266Q, N1156S).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether rutin hydrate (RH) has neuroprotective effects in a scopolamine-induced Alzheimer's disease-like learning and memory impairment rat model.
results_summary: RH treatment improved learning, memory, and synaptic plasticity in rats, attenuating scopolamine-induced deficits in behavioral tests and enhancing hippocampal protein expression related to neuroprotection.
population_specificity: Scopolamine-induced AD-like learning and memory impairment rat model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic effects of rutin in a SOD1-G93A mouse model of ALS, focusing on its potential to reduce SOD1 aggregation and improve motor function.
results_summary: Rutin reduced SOD1 aggregation and glial cell activation in spinal cords and brainstems, leading to improved motor function and motor neuron restoration in SOD1-G93A mice. The findings suggest rutin's multi-targeted approach may be promising for ALS treatment.
population_specificity: SOD1-G93A mouse model of ALS

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop and evaluate Rutin silver nanoparticles for enhanced solubility, bioavailability, and pharmacological effects, focusing on antioxidant, anticancer, and anticlastogenic potential.
results_summary: The optimized F12 formulation showed improved solubility, sustained drug release (97.3%), and promising antioxidant, anticancer (on G361 and MCF-7 cell lines), and anticlastogenic effects (reduced micronuclei frequency in mouse bone marrow cells).
population_specificity: In vitro cell lines (G361, MCF-7) and mice bone marrow cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a novel hydrogel (BP-Rut@Gel) combining Rutin with black phosphorus nanosheets for localized, photothermal-enhanced treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.
results_summary: The BP-Rut@Gel hydrogel demonstrated excellent biocompatibility, reduced inflammation in RA joints, and synergistically enhanced therapeutic effectiveness when combined with photothermal therapy under NIR irradiation.
population_specificity: Rheumatoid arthritis (RA) model (specific human or animal population not detailed in abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate rutin's therapeutic potential for psoriasis and its molecular mechanisms.
results_summary: Rutin significantly reduced PASI scores and improved skin lesions in mice, downregulating key inflammatory mediators. It targeted multiple signaling pathways relevant to psoriasis.
population_specificity: Imiquimod-induced murine psoriasis model (mice).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of a whey protein-based Pickering emulsion delivery system for rutin in improving muscle function and preventing sarcopenia in a zebrafish model.
results_summary: The Pickering emulsion significantly improved rutin bioaccessibility and enhanced zebrafish muscle movement, ATP levels, motor nerve length, and muscle structure compared to the model group. The interaction between rutin and whey proteins was primarily driven by van der Waals forces and hydrogen bonds.
population_specificity: Zebrafish (n = 10 per group) with dexamethasone-induced sarcopenia symptoms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop an electrochemical sensing platform using Fe2O3/N-rGO nanocomposites for the detection of rutin.
results_summary: The Fe2O3/N-rGO nanocomposite demonstrated high sensitivity (5632 μA mM-1) and a broad detection range (7 nM to 150 μM) for rutin, with desirable stability, selectivity, and practical applicability.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro electrochemical study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antibacterial activity of rutin-loaded chitosan nanoparticles (Rut-CS NPs) against pathogenic strains of Staphylococcus aureus.
results_summary: Rut-CS NPs demonstrated significant antibacterial activity, reducing staphyloxanthin pigment production, increasing susceptibility to hydrogen peroxide, altering cell membrane integrity, and inhibiting biofilm formation and hemolytic activity in S. aureus strains.
population_specificity: Pathogenic strains of Staphylococcus aureus.
effective_dosage: ½ MIC (minimum inhibitory concentration) of Rut-CS NPs was used for biofilm and hemolytic activity inhibition.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review Rutin's potential preventive and therapeutic effects on metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease (MAFLD), including its mechanisms and molecular targets.
results_summary: Rutin demonstrated potential in treating MAFLD by modulating lipid metabolism, reducing insulin resistance, diminishing inflammation and oxidative stress, combating obesity, and influencing intestinal flora. The exact mechanisms remain not fully elucidated.
population_specificity: Individuals with metabolic dysfunction-associated fatty liver disease (MAFLD).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the mechanism of Rutin in the therapy of ulcerative colitis (UC), focusing on its effects on inflammation and oxidative stress.
results_summary: Rutin reduced disease activity and pathological damage in UC mice, decreased inflammatory factors, and inhibited oxidative stress by modulating ROS, MDA, and SOD levels. It also suppressed the NLRP3 inflammasome, which was shown to be a key mechanism in its therapeutic effects.
population_specificity: Dextran sulfate sodium-stimulated mice and LPS-induced fetal human colon cells.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the signaling pathways by which Rutin may combat psoriasis, specifically its effects on inflammation and keratinocyte differentiation via the JAK2/STAT3 pathway.
results_summary: Rutin treatment reduced M5-induced proliferation and viability of HaCaT cells, reversed upregulation of inflammatory markers (IL-6, TNF-α, CXCL1, CXCL2, S100A7, S100A8), and attenuated aberrant keratinocyte differentiation by inhibiting JAK2/STAT3 signaling. Molecular docking suggested Rutin binds to STAT3 residues GLN326 and ASP334.
population_specificity: In vitro HaCaT cells (human keratinocyte cell line) stimulated with pro-inflammatory cytokines (M5 cocktail).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the potential of rutin nano-formulations for targeted therapy in various health disorders and discuss its clinical evidence, current status, and future opportunities.
results_summary: The study found that rutin exhibits multiple beneficial biological activities, including antibacterial, antifungal, anti-inflammatory, and neuroprotective effects, but its therapeutic use is limited by low solubility and stability issues, which may be addressed through nano-formulations.
population_specificity: Not specified (review article)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore Rutin's role in mitigating acetic acid-induced ulcerative colitis by targeting the HMGB1/TLR4/MYD88/NF-kB signaling pathway.
results_summary: Rutin significantly reduced colon weight/length ratio, improved histopathological changes, lowered serum LDH and CRP levels, decreased colonic TOS contents, and suppressed the HMGB1/TLR4/MYD88/NF-kB pathway activation compared to the acetic acid group.
population_specificity: Animal model (acetic acid-induced ulcerative colitis)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of rutin on IgA nephropathy, specifically its potential to reduce inflammation and fibrosis by inhibiting the TGF-β/SMAD pathways.
results_summary: Rutin reduced IgA deposition in the glomeruli of rats and alleviated inflammation and fibrosis by inhibiting TGF-β/SMAD pathways and downregulating α-SMA, a fibrosis marker.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats with induced IgA nephropathy.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the protective effect of rutin against acrylamide-induced reproductive toxicity in female rats.
results_summary: Rutin significantly protected against inflammation, oxidative stress, and DNA damage caused by acrylamide, likely due to its antioxidant properties. The study noted improvements in reproductive hormones, oxidative stress markers, and histological findings.
population_specificity: Female rats exposed to acrylamide.
effective_dosage: Not specified (therapy administered consecutively for 3 days).
study_duration: 3 days of rutin therapy after 10 days of acrylamide exposure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether rutin could protect against lead (Pb)-induced neurotoxicity by alleviating oxidative stress and inflammation.
results_summary: Rutin treatment significantly reduced Pb-induced cell death, oxidative stress, and inflammation by activating the Nrf2/ARE system, promoting antioxidant enzyme expression. Knocking down Nrf2 abolished rutin's protective effects.
population_specificity: In vitro cell study (specific cell type not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the therapeutic effects of GAL+RUT versus GAL+QUE in mitigating busulfan-induced testicular injury in rats.
results_summary: GAL+RUT showed some recovery effects on biochemical markers and testicular damage but was less effective than GAL+QUE in maintaining antioxidant capacity and reducing oxidative damage.
population_specificity: Wistar rats with busulfan-induced testicular injury
effective_dosage: 20 mg kg-1 body weight, delivered by oral gavage

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine Rutin's capacity to influence the DNA damage response (DDR) pathway and its selective cytotoxicity towards cancer cells while sparing normal cells.
results_summary: Rutin showed strong affinity for DDR pathway proteins, exhibited preferential cytotoxicity towards cancer cells (MDA-MB-231), and preserved normal fibroblast cell vitality. It also demonstrated antioxidant properties, reducing oxidative stress and enhancing anticancer effects.
population_specificity: MDA-MB-231 cancer cells, normal human fibroblast cells (2DD), and quiescent fibroblast cells (QFC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the therapeutic potential of MCQ/R NPs, integrating rutin and quercetin, for treating acute lung injury (ALI).
results_summary: MCQ/R NPs demonstrated exceptional antioxidative capabilities, biocompatibility, and significantly reduced lung tissue inflammation in LPS-induced ALI mice.
population_specificity: LPS-induced ALI mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of nitrogen-doped carbon dots (NCDs) bound to rutin for symptomatic treatment of Alzheimer's disease (AD) by assessing its ability to cross the blood-brain barrier and deliver therapeutic benefits.
results_summary: A single dose of 10 mg/kg NCDs-rutin produced behavioral, histological, and biomarker improvements comparable to a month-long regimen of 50 mg/kg rutin alone, demonstrating significant protective effects against neuronal loss, inflammation, and oxidative stress in AD models.
population_specificity: AlCl3-induced rat models of Alzheimer's disease.
effective_dosage: 10 mg/kg NCDs-rutin (single dose) and 50 mg/kg rutin (administered for 1 month).
study_duration: Single dose for NCDs-rutin; 1 month for rutin alone.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential anti-ulcer effects of rutin in experimental models and assess its viability as an alternative treatment for peptic ulcers.
results_summary: The review highlights rutin's anti-inflammatory, anticancer, and antioxidant properties, suggesting its potential as a promising treatment for peptic ulcers by inhibiting inflammatory mediators and the COX-2 enzyme. However, further research is needed to fully establish its therapeutic potential and clinical applicability.
population_specificity: Experimental models (not specified if human or animal).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the inhibitory mechanism of rutin on lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) and its potential as a therapeutic agent for tumor treatment.
results_summary: Rutin spontaneously bound to LDH's coenzyme binding site, forming a stable complex driven by hydrophobic forces and hydrogen bonds, altering LDH's secondary structure and inhibiting its catalytic activity in a dose-dependent manner. Food additives like ascorbic acid and tetrahydrocurcumin reduced the binding stability of rutin and LDH but did not exhibit synergism or antagonism.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)
interactions: Ascorbic acid and tetrahydrocurcumin reduced binding stability; no other interactions mentioned.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether rutin could mitigate ensartinib-induced hepatotoxicity by inhibiting TXNIP without compromising ensartinib's antitumor effects.
results_summary: Rutin was found to bind to TXNIP, partially promote its proteasomal degradation, and attenuate ensartinib-induced hepatotoxicity without interfering with its anticancer efficacy.
population_specificity: The study focused on the context of ALK-positive non-small cell lung cancer patients experiencing ensartinib-induced liver dysfunction.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop a rutin-controlled release system on titanium implants and evaluate its effects on osteogenesis and osseointegration, particularly under oxidative stress conditions.
results_summary: The study confirmed successful immobilization of the rutin-release system on titanium, demonstrating improved osteoblast adhesion, proliferation, and differentiation, as well as enhanced new bone formation around implants under oxidative stress.
population_specificity: Osteoporosis rat model and MC3T3-E1 cells (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of Rutin-coated manganese oxide nanoparticles (Ru/MnO2) as a tumor-targeting contrast agent for MRI and photothermal therapy.
results_summary: Ru/MnO2-5 demonstrated high T1 relaxivity (33.3 mM-1s-1), stability, photothermal efficacy, and superior tumor-targeting ability via GLUTs, showing promise for MRI and photothermal therapy in H22 tumors.
population_specificity: H22 tumor models (preclinical study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of rutin-loaded chitosan nanoparticles (rCNPs) for liver cancer treatment, focusing on cytotoxicity, biocompatibility, and hemocompatibility.
results_summary: The study found that rCNPs exhibited strong cytotoxic effects on Hep3B liver cancer cells, induced autophagy and NF-κB signaling, and showed excellent biocompatibility and hemocompatibility with minimal toxicity to normal cells. The nanoparticles also demonstrated pH-responsive drug release and ideal physicochemical properties for tumor targeting.
population_specificity: Human hepatoma Hep3B cells and L929 fibroblasts (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: 5 mg/mL rutin precursor (for cytotoxicity testing); IC50 value was 9.7 ± 0.19 μg/mL of rutin load.
study_duration: Not specified (in vitro study with time points up to 102 hours for drug release).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of rutin on Sjogren's syndrome (SS), focusing on its impact on oxidative stress, inflammation, and the CaR/NLRP3/NF-κB signaling pathway.
results_summary: Rutin significantly increased salivary secretion and gland index, reduced oxidative stress and inflammatory cytokines, and improved SS by modulating the CaR/NLRP3/NF-κB pathway. Overexpression of CaR partially counteracted rutin's effects, suggesting CaR as a potential treatment target.
population_specificity: Mice with Sjogren's syndrome (SS) and overexpressed calcium-sensing receptor (CaR) models.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether Rutin (RUT) could mitigate the hepatotoxic effects of daily low and high-dose Vortioxetine (VORTX) administration.
results_summary: Rutin significantly improved liver function, reduced oxidative stress, and attenuated inflammatory biomarkers and histopathological damage caused by VORTX, demonstrating strong hepatoprotective effects.
population_specificity: Rats (divided into six experimental groups)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the wound-healing potential of rutin-loaded zein gels, focusing on their antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and cell migration-promoting properties.
results_summary: The study found that rutin-loaded zein gels significantly promoted cell migration (~90% gap closure in 24h) and reduced wound area by 90% in Wistar rats by day 10, outperforming both free rutin and DuoDERM®. Anti-inflammatory effects were confirmed via reduced levels of TNF-α, IL-1β, and IL-6, and increased IL-10.
population_specificity: Wistar rats (animal study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Rutin (RUT) could protect against Zearalenone (ZEN)-induced reproductive toxicity in male mice.
results_summary: Rutin mitigated ZEN-induced disruptions in spermatogenic cell arrangement, improved sperm count and reduced sperm mortality. It also restored hormone levels (T, FSH, LH, E2) and reduced apoptosis markers (bcl-2, kiss1-r, caspase 8) in reproductive tissues.
population_specificity: Adult Kunming male mice (24 total, 6 per group).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential anticarcinogenic effect of Rutin on brain tissues in male mice with Ehrlich ascites carcinoma (EAC).
results_summary: The study found a significant reduction in brain volume in the tumor group compared to controls, with Rutin treatment reducing neuronal damage in the cortex and hippocampus. The difference in brain volume between the Rutin-treated group and controls was not significant.
population_specificity: Male mice with Ehrlich ascites carcinoma (EAC).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential therapeutic effectiveness of rutin in regulating disease-promoting systems (inflammation, oxidative stress, renin-angiotensin dysregulation) and its protective benefits against diabetic nephropathy and peripheral neuropathy.
results_summary: Rutin demonstrated protective effects against diabetic nephropathy and neuropathy in animal models by regulating inflammation, oxidative stress, and renin-angiotensin system dysregulation, suggesting its potential as a therapeutic agent.
population_specificity: Diabetic animal models

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential beneficial effects of Rutin (RUT) in a model of pattern-III lesion of multiple sclerosis (MS), comparing it to the standard drug dimethyl fumarate (DMF).
results_summary: Rutin significantly improved locomotor activity, motor coordination, and remyelination in the corpus callosum, while also reducing oxidative stress and inflammation. The higher dose of Rutin (100 mg/kg) showed more marked effects than the standard drug DMF in most tested parameters.
population_specificity: Male adult C57BL/6 mice with cuprizone-induced demyelination.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether rutin could mitigate neurotoxic effects induced by aluminum chloride (AlCl3) in rats.
results_summary: Rutin treatment significantly enhanced antioxidant enzyme activity, reduced lipid peroxidation, and modulated inflammatory responses, effectively countering oxidative stress and neuro-inflammation caused by AlCl3 exposure.
population_specificity: Rats exposed to AlCl3-induced neurotoxicity.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate rutin's binding affinity and inhibitory potential for CDK6 to assess its potential as a therapeutic molecule for cancer and CDK6-associated diseases.
results_summary: Rutin demonstrated strong binding affinity to CDK6, forming stable interactions with key residues, and significantly inhibited CDK6 kinase activity with an IC50 of 3.10 μM. The study validated rutin's spontaneous and potent inhibitory effects on CDK6.
population_specificity: In vitro and computational (molecular docking and simulations) study; no human or animal subjects specified.
effective_dosage: Not specified (IC50 value of 3.10 μM reported).
study_duration: 200 ns all-atom simulations; no intervention duration specified for experimental validation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of rutin fatty acid bioconjugates (RUT-O and RUT-L) as improved chemotherapeutics for non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) treatment.
results_summary: RUT-L showed anti-tumorigenic activity in NCI-H23 NSCLC cells by reducing viability, proliferation, and causing cell damage, while RUT-O had no significant effects. The effects of RUT-L resembled paraptosis, a non-apoptotic cell death pathway.
population_specificity: Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) cells (NCI-H23) and EpiAirway™ tissues.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the anticancer properties of rutin isolated from buckwheat seeds against Osteosarcoma cell lines (SAOS2) and assess its effects on cell viability, apoptosis, and migration.
results_summary: The study found that rutin fraction and standard rutin significantly reduced cell viability in SAOS2 cells, induced apoptosis, and inhibited cell migration. Rutin also upregulated pro-apoptotic genes and downregulated anti-apoptotic genes.
population_specificity: Osteosarcoma cell lines (SAOS2) and human gingival fibroblast cells (hGFs).
effective_dosage: IC-50 dose of 20 µg/ml for rutin fraction and 10 µg/ml for standard rutin.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect and mechanisms of rutin on osteogenic differentiation of mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs).
results_summary: Rutin promoted MSC differentiation toward the osteogenic lineage, increased osteogenic marker expression, and regulated p53, enhancing extracellular matrix formation via p65 phosphorylation and caspase-3 cleavage.
population_specificity: Mesenchymal stem cells extracted from umbilical cords.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether Rutin could protect against the adverse effects of Alendronate sodium (ALS) on the tongue tissue of rats.
results_summary: Rutin minimized structural and inflammatory damage to the tongue caused by ALS, preserving epithelial integrity and reducing collagen accumulation, likely due to its antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties.
population_specificity: Adult male albino rats
